instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
This arrived not powering on. No liquid damage. 

Noticed when power button is removed board powers on and boots fine. Replaced power button twice but still same results. Should the power button cable be replaced next or should something on the board be checked next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> level w/ and w/o touch ID connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: TouchID with corrosion on its board, or flex...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: solved after replacing cable touch id plugs into
